intro: Trinia hispida, commonly known as the rough trinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in dense spikes, and are usually white or pale pink in color. Trinia hispida is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
